oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Playtime at Olmsted Camp
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three teenaged boys in costumes. Left boy in bowler hat with ribbon trim, 2-buttons frock coat (double breasted) carrying cane. Long pants, tie, mustache. Middle boy white crewneck shirt, jacket with large buttons, loose pants tucked into gaiters, rouge spots on checks, white bill-less cap, leaning on cane. Right boy labeled Gib Benton in handwriting. White hat with brim, jacket with belt, knee-length shorts, knee socks, white shoes. Something fastened to left hip. 19-teens/1920s car in the background next to building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm life--New York (State); Farmers--New York (State); Hopkins family; Olmsted family; Rider family

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grandpa Rice and Family at the Benton Home

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Home of Eva Hopkins
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brick or stone house (upright with wing porch on right). Three people standing on lawn next to porch. Two women, one on either side of corner column. Right woman has hand on barrel labeled “CRB.” Man holding head of horse. Dog (husky/shepherd?) lying at man’s feet. Handwritten: “When Ray wants to drink tell him to tap the keg. What do you think of it anyway? We will write soon. Your’s rec’d. Your mother is much better. Iva”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm life--New York (State); Farmers--New York (State); Hopkins family; Olmsted family; Rider family

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Olmsted Camp—Vote for Sherman
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed: “725 – Camp Bown-Barrows, Sardinia, N.Y. Edward T. Miller, Sardinia, N.Y. oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Protection Methodist Church, Exterior View
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White wooden church w/open bell steeple. Chimney visible at back. Two arched windows on front on either side of arched door, round window over door. Four arched windows on side, four windows in basement level on side. Telegraph/telephone/electrical poles in foreground, one w/one crossbar & one w/two crossbars. Barn in left midground. Open building behind church for parking. Handwritten in white “M.E. Church. Protection, N.Y. 5b.”

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Family and Friends in Automobile
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image of open-top car (top is folded down) w/five people in it. Woman in dark dress?jacket? & white cap at steering wheel. Woman in front seat wearing dark top & sailor-type white shirt underneath, newsboy cap on head. Three people in back seat; two women in dark coats & white shirts, one w/dark cap & one w/white cap. Woman standing at right in back seat wearing dark jacket & white shirt, grey cap. Dark cow standing in field to right of car behind post & wire fence. Car’s license plate reads NY 1915 S7944? Last number obscured by left headlight. Car has running boards & open-wheel tires. House visible in background to right.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Freeman's Dry Goods Store
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A large wooden house with four windows organized horizontally. Downstairs is some kind of a store. Printed: “Albert M. Wilson Buffalo N.Y.” “H.B. Freeman’s Dry Goods Store, Main St., Sardinia N.Y.”

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Post Office and Hardware, Side View
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-story building w/high false front w/four pairs of roof brackets. Two windows on second floor front, three on side. Two picture windows on first floor front w/entrance between. Sign on side of building first floor reads “Patton’s Sun-Proof Paints/Go Farthest/Wear Longest/Pitcher & Pitcher [obscured]” Sign over picture window reads “Post Office” Sign between windows on second floor front appears to have same writing as “Patton’s etc.” on side of building. Man standing in front of building w/dog standing next to him. Handwritten at bottom in white “Post Office and Hardware” Telegraph/telephone/electrical pole w/three cross-bars in front of building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Public architecture; Sardinia (N.Y.); Protection (N.Y.); Stores, Retail--New York (State)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Glaser House
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-story wooden building w/front porch. Four windows on each story. Two doors on first floor in front. Four windows (two up, two down) on side. Two chimneys, one at each end of roof. Vines shading part of porch, large tree in leaf to left of picture. Metal pole fence in front. Sign on building on second floor front reads “Glaser House” Handwritten in white: “Glaser House. Protection. N.Y. 54”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Public architecture; Sardinia (N.Y.); Protection (N.Y.); Stores, Retail--New York (State)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Frank Bigelow Farm
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agricultural activities. Two white or grey horses hitched to a wagon full of hay. Wooden tower in front of barn w/hose going to top of tower. People in background in front of white house, windmill waterwell sticking up behind house.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hastings Hotel (Sardinia Hotel)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-story wooden building w/porch. Third floor is mansard roof. Four-story tower. Dozen-plus people standing on or near porch. One-horse buggy near right corner of building. Trees w/leaves on both sides of building.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lawrence Rupert, Child Picture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Young boy standing in yard. Birch tree in mid-background w/two potted plants next to tree. Boy is wearing white jacket-type top (possibly striped w/grey) & dark knickers, dark socks, dark shoes/boots.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Persons--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fred W. Bolender
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia formal portrait of man. Rimless glasses, dark hat w/ribbon on crown (squared off crown, not fedora), dark overcoat w/fur collar, suit underneath, striped tie, white shirt. Napoleonic pose.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Persons--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mr. and Mrs. George Briggs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Man & woman standing in front of white one-story house w/porch & dormer window. Picket fence behind people. Woman on left in high-necked white dress w/white apron or pinafore & buckled belt, dark hanky in left breast pocket, hair pulled back. Man in dark three-piece suit, white shirt, tie, cowboy-type grey hat.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Persons--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia People, Hamburg Fair 1912, Men in Barrel of Fun
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eight men standing behind painted wooden wall designed to look like large wooden barrel. Wall is painted “A Barrel of Fun Hamburg Fair 1912.” Men are all in dark suits & white shirts & ties. Man second from left in back has bow tie & mustache. All are wearing hats, mostly white w/dark ribbons around crowns. Man fourth from left in back has dark bowler hat. Man at left in front has dark hat w/squarish crown. Man in middle front has mustache. Man at right in front has glasses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Persons--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia People, Hamburg Fair 1912, Friends in Barrel of Fun
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six people standing behind painted wooden wall designed to look like large wooden barrel. Wall is painted “A Barrel of Fun” From left: Man in white shirt, bow tie, newsboy cap. Woman in white blouse, dark hat w/two feathers(?). Man in white shirt & dark tie w/newsboy ca. Boy in white shirt, dark tie, newsboy cap. Woman in white blouse, dark middy tie, dark hat w/decoration sticking up on left side. Man in dark jacket, white shirt, tie, dark hat.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Persons--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Union School Number 8, Exterior View, Children
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Group of children w/teachers (?) in front of school. On the school written: “No. 8” Printed in white: “Sardinia School” Handwritten: “My Dear Masie- Will write you in a few days Think you had better come home. I don’t think”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: School buildings--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Union School Number 8, Exterior View, Children Playing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large/tall wooden building w/children around it. Printed: “122100” “Albert M. Wilson, Buffalo N.Y.” “Sardinia Union School, Sardinia, N.Y.”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: School buildings--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Union School, Exterior View
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Picture a little tilted. Large wooden building. Printed in white: “Sardinia School”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: School buildings--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Sawmill, Cheese Boxes, Barrels
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three boys/men in manufacturing-ish facility. Boy on left wearing grey shirt, dark overalls, newsboy cap, leaning on machine. Boy in rear wearing newsboy cap. Boy to right wearing white shirt, dark pants w/suspenders. Appears to be cardboard coming out of/going into machine.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sawmills--New York (State); Sawmill workers--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chaffee Sawmill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mill building w/small tower on roof. Large overhanging porch roof at right side w/stair going up to door. Sign under porch roof reads “Flour & Feed” RR poles visible in background w/four cross-bars. Handwritten in white: “Chaffe (sic) Mills”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sawmills--New York (State); Sawmill workers--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Sawmill Near Hosmer Bridge
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lumber/mill scene. Three boys/men standing in mid-foreground. Man at left wearing shirt, pants w/suspenders, hat. Man in middle wearing coat, pants, dark hat. Man at right wearing white shirt, overalls, hat, leaning on wood. Boy in dark shirt, pants w/overalls, newsboy cap standing on wood near right-hand man’s hand. Man in white hat barely visible at left behind wood. Tractor at right of picture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sawmills--New York (State); Sawmill workers--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sardinia Flour Mills
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-story mill next to small stream. Water flowing out of raceway to right of mill building. Barn in background. Trees in leaf in foreground to left. Other buildings barely visible in trees to left background. Printed: “Sardinia Flour Mills, Sardinia N. Y.” “Albert M. Wilson Buffalo NY””626” Handwritten “1909”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sawmills--New York (State); Sawmill workers--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mail Time
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mail delivery by horse & buggy. Two dark horses pulling square buggy labeled US Mail RFD No.1. Mail carrier visible in buggy. Mailbox on post by right rear buggy wheel. Snow everywhere. Trees in background. Small building at left rear.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural Free Delivery; Postal service--New York (State)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Old Mill Pond in Sardinia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tinted image of pond w/trees in leaf on either side. Barn in background in trees on right. Boat on pond w/three people in it. Telegraph/telephone/electrical pole visible in trees in mid-left w/three cross-bars. Bridge over pond in background. Printed: “1180 – The Old Mill Pond, Sardinia, N. Y.” “Edward J. Miller, Sardinia, N. Y. Made in Germany”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ponds--New York (State); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images in this collection are not to be used for any commercial purposes.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kids at Hopkins Farm House
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Faded sepia in color. Six children standing between two trees. House corner in background, inc. window w/shutters. Dog (mostly white w/brown ears) hitched to sled.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm life--New York (State); Farmers--New York (State); Hopkins family; Olmsted family; Rider family
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Sardinia (N.Y.)
